page.title: 10TOURISTS IN CAMBRIDGE
page.content: TOURISM IS A WIDE-SPREAD ASPECT OF CAMBRIDGE. THOUSANDS OF TOURISTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD CROWD THE NARROW STREETS IN TOWN. THEY PHOTOGRAPH BUILDINGS, HOUSES AND SHOPS, WHICH THE PEOLE WHO LIVE NEARBY TAKE LITTLE INTEREST IN. THE MAIN ATTRACTION IS THE COLLEGES, WHICH STRETCH FROM ST. JOHNS STREET, THROUGH TRINITY STREET TO KINGS PARADE. MANY FOREIGNERS FLOCK ALONG THE ROADS LOOKING AT THE LARGE ARCHWAYS, WHICH REVEAL SUNNY, GREEN LAWNS INSIDE THE MOST POPULAR SIGHTS ARE{THE BACKS,}WHERE MOST OF THE CAMERAS ARE FOCUSED ON KINGS COLLEGE CHAPEL. ALTHOUGH TOURISM IS QUITE ANNOYING (THE WAY THEY USE UP THE PARKS AND GREENS,CROWD IN TOWN AND DROP LITTER) THE TRADERS MAKE GOOD BUSINESS FROM THEIR SHORT STAY. ALSO, TO SOME EXTENT, THEY HELP COLLEGES BY CONTRIBUTING MONEY.
